column4: my little brother cant get wireless working. He's going to torrent XP and give up on linux if he cant. Help me save him, please :(
is he hooked up to a active internet connection?
He successfuly connected by wire, but he wants the wireless to run.
the reason why i was asking is because I had the same problem untill I hooked up to the internet, updated linux, and then downloaded the drivers
Their wireless is hooked up, we did update, and we used wcutter to acquire the drivers from broadcom
does the connection show up under if you type: sudo lshw -C network
hang on a sec...
it gave us a lot... what am i lookijng for
looking for a connection that you would identifiy with wireless
in my case   *-network:0
http://paste.ubuntu.com/67694/
do you have the wireless manager in your taskbar (next to your time)?
The network manager is, no wireless manager
click on it and tell me what you see, I see two categories: Wired Network (under which I see nothing) and then Wireless Network (under which I see a bunch of access points)
wlan0 and eth0...?
can you take a screen shot?
No categories
Im communicating with him over AIM, lol
I dont think its the same program. i think he's using knetworkmanager
when did he install what version of ubuntu and what modifications has he made?
Yesterday, it was Hardy, he did a version upgrade to Ibex.... thats it
access point
